attributes.action: Deem sales of lottery tickets & scratchcards as non-essential through COVID-19
attributes.additional_details:
Anything which requires our retail workers to come into contact with customers creates risk at this time. Retailers are bring forward many measures that help their colleagues (e.g. self scanning & encouraging cashless transactions) however retailers cannot turn off lottery machines unless instructed by Camelot.

I'm calling on the government to compel Camelot to either cease lottery ticket sales or move too wholly online whilst retail restrictions are in place and bookmakers closed.
attributes.background: Stop Camelot from selling lottery tickets and scratchcards in retail stores during the retail restrictions due to COVID-19

rejection.details:
"The Government has closed non-essential retailers, and provided a list of those that may remain open. Of those allowed to remain open, it is a choice for retailers whether to do so, and which items they continue to sell, including lottery tickets. The Government has also issued advice to retailers about social distancing and keeping staff safe: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/social-distancing-in-the-workplace-during-coronavirus-covid-19-sector-guidance#retail

You could start a petition calling for the National Lottery to be suspended during the outbreak, if this is something you would like to see happen.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

www.gov.uk/coronavirus 

https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support 

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips
